    • Outlier Detection - Python
    • Data Transformation - Python
    • Data wrangling with R 

    # Example multivariate dataset
data <- mtcars[, c("mpg", "disp", "hp", "wt")]

# Calculate Mahalanobis distance
mahalanobis_dist <- mahalanobis(data, colMeans(data), cov(data))

# Set chi-square threshold for outlier detection (95% confidence)
threshold <- qchisq(0.95, df = ncol(data))

# Identify outliers
outliers <- mahalanobis_dist > threshold
print(outliers)
              Mazda RX4       Mazda RX4 Wag          Datsun 710      Hornet 4 Drive 
              FALSE               FALSE               FALSE               FALSE 
  Hornet Sportabout             Valiant          Duster 360           Merc 240D 
              FALSE               FALSE               FALSE               FALSE 
           Merc 230            Merc 280           Merc 280C          Merc 450SE 
              FALSE               FALSE               FALSE               FALSE

              FALSE               FALSE               FALSE               FALSE

    # Visualise results
library(ggplot2)
data$Outlier <- ifelse(outliers, "Outlier", "Normal")
ggplot(data, aes(x = hp, y = mpg, color = Outlier)) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  labs(title = "Multivariate Outlier Detection with Mahalanobis Distance") +
  theme_minimal()

    # Perform PCA
pca <- prcomp(data[, c("mpg", "disp", "hp", "wt")], scale. = TRUE)
pca_data <- as.data.frame(pca$x)
pca_data$Outlier <- data$Outlier

# Scatter plot of first two principal components
ggplot(pca_data, aes(x = PC1, y = PC2, color = Outlier)) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  labs(title = "PCA Plot for Outlier Detection") +
  theme_minimal()

    Source Code
    ```{r}
# Example multivariate dataset
data <- mtcars[, c("mpg", "disp", "hp", "wt")]

# Calculate Mahalanobis distance
mahalanobis_dist <- mahalanobis(data, colMeans(data), cov(data))

# Set chi-square threshold for outlier detection (95% confidence)
threshold <- qchisq(0.95, df = ncol(data))

# Identify outliers
outliers <- mahalanobis_dist > threshold
print(outliers)

# Visualise results
library(ggplot2)
data$Outlier <- ifelse(outliers, "Outlier", "Normal")
ggplot(data, aes(x = hp, y = mpg, color = Outlier)) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  labs(title = "Multivariate Outlier Detection with Mahalanobis Distance") +
  theme_minimal()

```

```{r}
# Perform PCA
pca <- prcomp(data[, c("mpg", "disp", "hp", "wt")], scale. = TRUE)
pca_data <- as.data.frame(pca$x)
pca_data$Outlier <- data$Outlier

# Scatter plot of first two principal components
ggplot(pca_data, aes(x = PC1, y = PC2, color = Outlier)) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  labs(title = "PCA Plot for Outlier Detection") +
  theme_minimal()
```
